title: security.tls.version.min 1 not respected (Linux Fedora, flatpak)
content:
I am trying to connect to an email server that is still on tls 1.0 using Thunderbird on Fedora linux (flatpak version). I have set the following parameters 

   security.tls.version.min 1    security.tls.version.enable-deprecated true

but Thunderbird returns a "Non-overidable TLS error occured" and does not successfully connect to the server.

I note that Thunderbird on macOS can in fact connect to the same email server after setting the above two parameters. Thus, this appears to be either a problem with the Linux version, or the fedora Flatpak version in particular.

Does anyone know of a way to get around this? I talked to email provider, but they have no plans to update their tls certificate any time soon...
